oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MODELING THE DYNAMICS OF A BAR SYSTEM AT DUCK, NC, USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Boczar-Karakiewicz, B.
Romanczyk, W.
Bona, J.L.
Thornton, E.B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bar system
Duck
NC
bar modeling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The temporal evolution of nearshore bar topography forced by incident, wind-generated waves is predicted by a two-dimensional (2D) model. Predictions are compared with observed bathymetry from Duck, North Carolina, USA, acquired by the Field Research Facility (FRF) of the US Corps of Engineers over a period of 17 years (1980 - 1997). The model simulations presented are seen to approximate well the formation of the most frequently-observed shore-parallel bars at Duck as well as dynamic changes in their pattern caused by storm waves and varying mean water level.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
